name: places/ChIJw-tSx6xZwokRVFWyMia-Ezg

displayName.text: Cho Cheung Wing Chun Kung Fu

adrFormatAddress: 520 8th Ave, New York, NY 10018, USA

originalText.text: Sifu teaches Wing Chun as a complete martial arts form rather than something to simplify for the sake of commercialization. While his attention to detail can be intimidating, seeing it in action at least twice every week encourages me to be more meticulous not only in Wing Chun but in my daily life as well.

text.text: Sifu teaches Wing Chun as a complete martial arts form rather than something to simplify for the sake of commercialization. While his attention to detail can be intimidating, seeing it in action at least twice every week encourages me to be more meticulous not only in Wing Chun but in my daily life as well.

originalText.text: If you are seeking Wing Chun instruction, I highly recommend Sifu Cho Cheung. His adherence to correct form and principles gives the practitioner a solid foundation to continually build on. He is both engaging and patient with his students. I had a great experience.

text.text: If you are seeking Wing Chun instruction, I highly recommend Sifu Cho Cheung. His adherence to correct form and principles gives the practitioner a solid foundation to continually build on. He is both engaging and patient with his students. I had a great experience.

originalText.text: With a quarter of century of martial arts training, I can state that Sifu Cho Cheung embodies a rare symbiosis of knowledge and expertise in Wing Chun. Three are the key traits that differentiate his teaching: 1. Strict adherence to the lineage of Wing Chun, 2. Focus on proper execution of forms to engender an in-depth knowledge of the art from both a physical and philosophical standpoint, 3. Talent in maintaining among students a unique esprit de corps, respect and identity with a common purpose—the indisputable key pillars driving the success of any martial art school. Sifu Cheung rises the bar for other Wing Chun teachers and I recommend him without hesitation to anyone, regardless of age, who is seriously committed to learning Wing Chun.

text.text: With a quarter of century of martial arts training, I can state that Sifu Cho Cheung embodies a rare symbiosis of knowledge and expertise in Wing Chun. Three are the key traits that differentiate his teaching: 1. Strict adherence to the lineage of Wing Chun, 2. Focus on proper execution of forms to engender an in-depth knowledge of the art from both a physical and philosophical standpoint, 3. Talent in maintaining among students a unique esprit de corps, respect and identity with a common purpose—the indisputable key pillars driving the success of any martial art school. Sifu Cheung rises the bar for other Wing Chun teachers and I recommend him without hesitation to anyone, regardless of age, who is seriously committed to learning Wing Chun.

originalText.text: I've tried a bunch of kung fu schools in the city and they are usually lacking in something, be it blasé instructors, no organization or curriculum of any kind, or the fact that they run a glorified cardio class, but advertising it as a martial arts school. Cho Cheung Wing Chun is the exception. Sifu is great, he keeps the training very traditional, with a lot of detail and understanding, but with an emphasis on practicality. No macho or tough guys here, just people who want earn their martial skills thru hard, rigorous work. Can't recommend him enough.

originalText.text: Sifu Cho Cheung is an inspiring and knowledgable teacher. As one who studied Karate for 12 years, I was drawn to his attention to detail and ability to easily convey the logical applications of Wing Chun. He is a true artist and master.
